required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Drug-Drug Interaction of Pyrotinib With a Moderate CYP3A Inducer
clinical_study.official_title: A Single-Center, Single-Arm, Open-Label, Fixed-Sequence Phase I Drug-Drug Interaction Clinical Study of the Effect of Efavirenz on Pharmacokinetics of Maleate Pyrotinib in Chinese Healthy Subjects.

brief_summary.textblock: This drug-drug interaction (DDI) study had been designed to investigate the effect of a moderate CYP 3A inducer efavirenz on the pharmacokinetics of maleate pyrotinib in Chinese healthy volunteers.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: To observe the effect of efavirenz on the pharmacokinetics of pyrotinib and to evaluate the safety of pyrotinib, efavirenz and their coadministration in Chinese healthy subjects. The subjects will take pyrotinib at first single dose, then washout period, and take it at second single dose after multiple administration of efavirenz to get a full induction condition.

primary_outcome.measure: Summary of Pharmacokinetic parameters Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) for pyrotinib.
Summary of Pharmacokinetic parameters Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve from 0 to any time before the last quantifiable concentration (AUC0-t) for pyrotinib.
Summary of Pharmacokinetic parameters Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve from 0 to infinite time (AUCinf) for pyrotinib.

secondary_outcome.measure: The incidence and severity of adverse events/serious adverse events (based on NCI-CTCAE 5.0): Laboratory indicators, 12-lead electrocardiogram (ECG), physical examination, vital signs, etc.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 14 days post last dose, up to approximately 2 month

intervention.description: single oral dose, 600 mg, fasted, at bedtime.
